oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Knoxville Negro
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bartow G. Wilson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Knoxville Negro. Emphasizing the Great Era of Progress Prevalent in Negro Knoxville Today By BARTOW G. WILSON Former Staff-writer, Advertising Manager, Sports Editor and Columnist for The Knoxville Herald With a Foreword by PROF. CHAS. W. CANSLER Statesman, Lawyer, Author and Educator and "EVIDENCES OF THE PROGRESS OF A RACE" By Dr. Henry Morgan Green Scholar, Financier, Scientist and Author. Published June, 1929. Printed by: Trent Printing Co. 2104 Magnolia Ave. Knoxville, Tenn., U. S. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans; History; Portraits; Biographies;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Loaned for scanning from a private collection. The McClung Historical Collection does not own the original.
